title: WESTCOAST / GARY FASCHA DQ
description: Ask Gary if he knows how to turn back time.

dialogueTree.title: You: ""Gary, do you know how to turn back..."
dialogueTree.text: "Gary, do you know how to turn back time?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Do I know how to turn back time......"
links.text: "Do I know how to turn back time...?" He gives you a sideways glance. "Is that a trick question?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you *still* pursuing this?" Th..."
links.text: "Are you *still* pursuing this?" The lieutenant gives you a tired look.

links.title: You: ""What's wrong? Material not good en..."
links.text: "What's wrong? Material not good enough to send back to your Seolite masters?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not going to dignify that with..."
links.text: "I'm not going to dignify that with an answer." The lieutenant's voice is cold and official as he opens his notebook. "Make it quick, we're in the middle of a murder investigation."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Make what quick?" He shrugs. "You'..."
links.text: "Make what quick?" He shrugs. "You're asking me about time travel. Is this some kind of a trick?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. This is important.""
links.text: "Yes. This is important."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""More important than our murder inv..."
links.text: "More important than our murder investigation?"

links.title: You: ""Now *that's* a trick question, rig..."
links.text: "Now *that's* a trick question, right Gary?" (Wink at him.)

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Ugh... yeah, yeah. I guess." He sh..."
links.text: "Ugh... yeah, yeah. I guess." He shrugs, looking confused.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Make it quick," remarks the lieute..."
links.text: "Make it quick," remarks the lieutenant dryly and opens his notebook. "And the question was rhetorical, not a trick."

links.title: You: ""Potentially more important than *a..."
links.text: "Potentially more important than *anything* ever before."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No," the lieutenant replies with a..."
links.text: "No," the lieutenant replies with a sigh and opens his notebook. "It really isn't. Just please make it quick, so we can get back to our low-priority murder case."

links.title: You: ""I guess not.""
links.text: "I guess not."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In that case please make it extra..."
links.text: "In that case please make it extra quick, so we can get back to it," says the lieutenant and opens his notebook. "I mean it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No?" he asks, surprised. "Because..."
links.text: "No?" he asks, surprised. "Because I could've sworn that's what you're doing right now."

links.title: You: ""It *will* make sense, I promise.""
links.text: "It *will* make sense, I promise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fine." He opens his notebook and s..."
links.text: "Fine." He opens his notebook and starts leafing through the pages. "Just make it quick. We need to get back to our case."

links.title: You: ""Just... please, Kim, trust me on t..."
links.text: "Just... please, Kim, trust me on this."

links.title: Rhetoric: "A question for an answer, huh? The..."
links.text: A question for an answer, huh? The answer must be really obvious.

links.title: You: ""I'm all out of tricks, Gary. Tell..."
links.text: "I'm all out of tricks, Gary. Tell me what you know."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Phew..." He scratches his head. "I..."
links.text: "Phew..." He scratches his head. "I don't know what to tell you. I mean of course there are *theories* out there..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The further out, the better."
links.text: The further out, the better.

links.title: You: ""What kind of theories are we talki..."
links.text: "What kind of theories are we talking about here?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well, there's a very interesting c..."
links.text: "Well, there's a very interesting cryptid known as the Semper Maa. And a certain tribe of ancient kipts who practiced 'digital castigation,' though frankly I don't know how *compelling* you'll find that theory..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And then you hear rumours..." He f..."
links.text: "And then you hear rumours..." He flashes a quick side-glance at the lieutenant. "... that the Seolites possess technology that actually lets them move through time like it's a corridor. Back and forth, you see."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "The lieutenant stops writing in his..."
links.text: The lieutenant stops writing in his notebook for a moment. It's only a fraction of a second, but you catch it.

links.title: You: ""What about something pale-related,..."
links.text: "What about something pale-related, any theories?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Pale-related..." he repeats and pa..."
links.text: "Pale-related..." he repeats and pauses to think. "An interesting idea, but I can't say anything really comes to mind, no."

links.title: You: ""Tell me about this cryptid, the Se..."
links.text: "Tell me about this cryptid, the Semper Maa."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""*Cryptids*, actually. It's a so-ca..."
links.text: "*Cryptids*, actually. It's a so-called 'colonial animal', presenting as a large singular body, when in actuality, it's a congregation of tiny organisms working in unison."

links.title: Inland Empire: "What if *you* only appear as a larg..."
links.text: What if *you* only appear as a large singular body, are actually a congregation of tiny organisms working in unison?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Get out of here, dreamer! Don't you..."
links.text: Get out of here, dreamer! Don't you think we'd know about it?

links.title: Volition: "If it were true those organisms wou..."
links.text: If it were true those organisms would *not* be working *in unison*.

links.title: Endurance: "That's because some them just don't..."
links.text: That's because some them just don't have the best interests of the colony in mind.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Hey, maybe if the rest of you took..."
links.text: Hey, maybe if the rest of you took a chill-pill every now and then, they'd be more motivated?

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Shut up, we can't hear what he's sa..."
links.text: Shut up, we can't hear what he's saying!

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""It's found in the subtropical jung..."
links.text: "It's found in the subtropical jungles of Samara. Extremely difficult to spot as it appears to the untrained eye like common mud. It's thought to be impossible to catch and *very* dangerous."

links.title: You: ""Wait, it looks like mud?""
links.text: "Wait, it looks like mud?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Yes, it blends in with the jungle..."
links.text: "Yes, it blends in with the jungle floor. Unsurprisingly, it's become the subject of many local myths -- some have even described it as an angry forest spirit or a manifestation of the forest itself."

links.title: You: ""How dangerous is it?""
links.text: "How dangerous is it?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I once heard a story about a whole..."
links.text: "I once heard a story about a whole village disappearing overnight, without a trace. Can you imagine that?" He shakes his head. "Just a large patch of mud where the settlement was."

links.title: You: ""Yes, vividly.""
links.text: "Yes, vividly."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Whole area is completely abandoned..."
links.text: "Whole area is completely abandoned now. Locals won't even go near it. They swear the mud writhes and occasionally grows strange shapes."

links.title: Authority: "Jungles, villages, mud... he better..."
links.text: Jungles, villages, mud... he better not be wasting your time.

links.title: You: ""Terrifying...""
links.text: "Terrifying..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""It gets even scarier. You see, the..."
links.text: "It gets even scarier. You see, the Semper Maa has also evolved a curious defensive mechanism. When threatened, it has the ability to revert back to an earlier stage in its own lifecycle. It may even be able to do this *continually*, ad infinitium..."

links.title: Half Light: "So the scary sentient mud is also i..."
links.text: So the scary sentient mud is also immortal? That's good news.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Now, here's where it gets *really..."
links.text: "Now, here's where it gets *really interesting*. It's believed that the mechanism by which the Semper Maa reverts actually reverses the flow of time itself..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "To be able to revert back to a prev..."
links.text: To be able to revert back to a previous version of yourself, to the one before all the mistakes... that's why we're here!

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""... by about 4.5 seconds.""
links.text: "... by about 4.5 seconds."

links.title: You: ""Hang on, I *still* don't see how t..."
links.text: "Hang on, I *still* don't see how this immortal mud monster is gonna help me turn back time."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well, you see, the fascinating thi..."
links.text: "Well, you see, the fascinating thing about it is that this temporal reversion is said to extend to anything *touching* the Semper Maa at the moment of reversal."

links.title: You: ""So if I cover myself with this sen..."
links.text: "So if I cover myself with this sentient mud..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""... and attack it over and over ag..."
links.text: "... and attack it over and over again, you could theoretically punch your way back to the Franconigerian era!"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Like a diving suit powered by pain."
links.text: Like a diving suit powered by pain.

links.title: You: ""Seems like a dick move.""
links.text: "Seems like a dick move."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Assuming you survive the encounter..."
links.text: "Assuming you survive the encounter... But that's way down the line of course..."

links.title: You: ""Very well. This Semper Maa will pu..."
links.text: "Very well. This Semper Maa will pull my ox-cart through the ages."

links.title: You: ""There's balance in nature, Gary. M..."
links.text: "There's balance in nature, Gary. Man was not meant to play god."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Like a submarine fuelled by sufferi..."
links.text: Like a submarine fuelled by suffering.

links.title: Half Light: "Like an exo-skeleton powered by fea..."
links.text: Like an exo-skeleton powered by fear.

links.title: You: ""So if I *attack* this sentient mud..."
links.text: "So if I *attack* this sentient mud..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well, if you *cover yourself* in i..."
links.text: "Well, if you *cover yourself* in it first, *then* attack it, you could theoretically basically punch your way back to the Franconigerian era!"

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm convinced. What's our ne..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm convinced. What's our next step?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well, first we'd need to secure fu..."
links.text: "Well, first we'd need to secure funding for an expedition, then assemble a team, gather supplies... There's probably a million other little things, but with the resources of the RCM behind you..." He shrugs. "It could be feasible."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He seems to have an unrealistic ide..."
links.text: He seems to have an unrealistic idea of the RCM's budget and manpower...

links.title: You: ""I don't think the RCM is gonna go..."
links.text: "I don't think the RCM is gonna go for it, Gary."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I concur, detective," the lieutena..."
links.text: "I concur, detective," the lieutenant interjects without looking up from his notes. "It's completely *unfeasible*."

links.title: Empathy: "His voice betrays relief, he really..."
links.text: His voice betrays relief, he really didn't want to have to argue with you over this.

links.title: You: ""That would take forever! Isn't the..."
links.text: "That would take forever! Isn't there just like a pill I could take or something...?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I haven't really heard of any time..."
links.text: "I haven't really heard of any time-travel pills, officer..." He rubs his chin, thinking.

links.title: You: ""Hmmm, what else have you got?""
links.text: "Hmmm, what else have you got?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Listen, officer. I know it sounds..."
links.text: "Listen, officer. I know it sounds like quite the task, but the potential, it just can't be denied..."

links.title: You: ""This sounds like a dead end to me,..."
links.text: "This sounds like a dead end to me, Gary."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""It's true that every expedition up..."
links.text: "It's true that every expedition up to now has failed, and that several have *vanished* without a trace, but the potential is there, officer. It just can't be denied..."

links.title: Logic: "Oh, yes it can. Easily."
links.text: Oh, yes it can. Easily.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And speaking personally, arranging..."
links.text: "And speaking personally, arranging an expedition seems like the most promising option overall, so I'm not really sure what else to tell you..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And personally, it seems easier th..."
links.text: "And personally, it seems easier than, say, accessing deep-secret Seolite technology, but to each his own."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And personally, it seems more civi..."
links.text: "And personally, it seems more civilised than, say, digital castigation, but to each his own."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And personally, it seems easier th..."
links.text: "And personally, it seems easier than accessing deep-secret Seolite technology and more civilised than digital castigation, but to each his own."

links.title: You: ""I asked you about temporal manipul..."
links.text: "I asked you about temporal manipulation, not mud."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I'm getting there, officer." He sm..."
links.text: "I'm getting there, officer." He smiles. "You see, the Semper Maa has also evolved a curious defensive mechanism. When threatened, it has the ability to revert back to an earlier stage in its own lifecycle. It may even be able to do this *continually*, ad infinitum..."

links.title: You: ""Gary, are you wasting my time righ..."
links.text: "Gary, are you wasting my time right now?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""No, no, not at all... You see, the..."
links.text: "No, no, not at all... You see, the Semper Maa has also evolved a curious defensive mechanism. When threatened, it has the ability to revert back to an earlier stage in its own lifecycle. It may even be able to do this *continually*, ad infinitium..."

links.title: You: ""No, I'm sorry, but I can't.""
links.text: "No, I'm sorry, but I can't."

links.title: You: ""I don't *want* to imagine that.""
links.text: "I don't *want* to imagine that."

links.title: You: "(Scoff.) "I've seen the sky cry blo..."
links.text: (Scoff.) "I've seen the sky cry blood while everything turns to vapour. I think I can manage, Gary."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Ahm..." He's so surprised he even..."
links.text: "Ahm..." He's so surprised he even forgets to close his mouth. "That's... yes, that's also horrible. I mean in a much grander scale. Exactly what happened to that village."

links.title: Shivers: "This event will be beyond all scale..."
links.text: This event will be beyond all scales.

links.title: You: ""You really think the Seolites can..."
links.text: "You really think the Seolites can really move *through* time?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well..." His eyes instinctively da..."
links.text: "Well..." His eyes instinctively dart to the lieutenant before he continues *sotto voce*: "How else did they get so far ahead of everyone in the tech-race?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, how *did* you guys get so fa..."
links.text: "Yeah, how *did* you guys get so far ahead?" (Turn to the lieutenant.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No part of *me* is part of *this*..."
links.text: "No part of *me* is part of *this* conversation. Oh, no." The lieutenant keeps his eyes fixed on his notebook. "That's a special thing you two are enjoying. With each other."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Everything's cool. Nothing wrong w..."
links.text: "Everything's cool. Nothing wrong with a little speculative inquiry." The man shrugs awkwardly. "But really, officer, how *do* you explain how the Seolites developed such a lead over the rest of us?"

links.title: Composure: "He's *really* trying to convey how..."
links.text: He's *really* trying to convey how cool and natural this all is for him.

links.title: You: ""By working longer and harder than..."
links.text: "By working longer and harder than *everyone* else?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Sure, the Seolites are hard worker..."
links.text: "Sure, the Seolites are hard workers, everyone knows that..." He quickly glances at the lieutenant again. "But hard work alone? I don't buy it..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Permission to laugh, officer?" He..."
links.text: "Permission to laugh, officer?" He rolls his eyes. "No way, I don't buy it..."

links.title: You: ""By funnelling a larger percentage..."
links.text: "By funnelling a larger percentage of their country's budget to research?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Absolutely!" He nods enthusiastica..."
links.text: "Absolutely!" He nods enthusiastically, shooting a quick glance at the lieutenant. "That definitely *helps*, but that alone? I don't buy it..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: "The man forces out an unpleasant an..."
links.text: The man forces out an unpleasant and artificial laugh. "C'mon, officer, you *know* that's not it. No way!"

links.title: You: ""By all joining in solidarity, ever..."
links.text: "By all joining in solidarity, everyone doing their part to keep the big machine moving?"

links.title: You: ""By seeking answers from behind the..."
links.text: "By seeking answers from behind the veil, from the void?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I've personally never witnessed a..."
links.text: "I've personally never witnessed a Seolite commit corporate espionage," he says, determined not to glance at the lieutenant. "*However* there are rumours, articles, respected opinions..."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "And he glanced!"
links.text: And he glanced!

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: "He clears his throat and continues...."
links.text: He clears his throat and continues. "That's actually peas, nothing, no amount of corporate espionage would ever would ever put them *so far* ahead of everyone else..."

links.title: Logic: "You're underestimating corporate es..."
links.text: You're underestimating corporate espionage, Gary.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""From the void?" He gives you an in..."
links.text: "From the void?" He gives you an intent look and crosses his arms. "I don't think that's it. I think there's a *much* more sinister explanation..."

links.title: Half Light: "Cannibalism?"
links.text: Cannibalism?

links.title: You: ""By letting the free market dictate..."
links.text: "By letting the free market dictate the course of technological progress?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Could be, could easily be." He nod..."
links.text: "Could be, could easily be." He nods enthusiastically, shooting a quick glance at the lieutenant. "I mean it definitely *helps*, but the market alone? I don't buy it..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Officer," he says with confidence,..."
links.text: "Officer," he says with confidence, "the average consumer is a moron. Leave it to them and we'd all be living in fake-bamboo huts, burning carcinogenic incense and playing the bongos. No way that's the reason!"

links.title: You: ""I'm sure they have a strong centra..."
links.text: "I'm sure they have a strong central government keeping things running smoothly."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Like clockwork, I'm sure, no doubt..."
links.text: "Like clockwork, I'm sure, no doubt about it. But is that *really* enough to take such an astronomical lead? I don't think so..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Officer, wake up." The man snaps h..."
links.text: "Officer, wake up." The man snaps his fingers in front of your face. "No *way* that's the reason why they're winning the race!"

links.title: You: ""Isolation obviously, keeping Seol..."
links.text: "Isolation obviously, keeping Seol for Seolites. Very motivating."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I don't know... Sounds a bit *ince..."
links.text: "I don't know... Sounds a bit *incestuous* to me, but sure -- none of my business, I'm not a Seolite." He quickly glances at the lieutenant. "But no way *that's* the reason they're winning the race..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Oh, trying to keep only one type of..."
links.text: Oh, trying to keep only one type of people around you is suddenly 'incestuous', Gary?

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Sure, they got the place locked do..."
links.text: "Sure, they got the place locked down tighter than a Himean asshole, but that alone?" He's shaking his head. "No way, I don't buy it..."

links.title: You: ""By developing an aesthetics of pur..."
links.text: "By developing an aesthetics of pure functionality, separated from traditional notions of beauty?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""You know, I don't think that's it...."
links.text: "You know, I don't think that's it." He shakes his head. "I bet there's plenty of beauty over there, art and inspiration too, but that's not why they're winning..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Save it for the phyrro-heads," he..."
links.text: "Save it for the phyrro-heads," he says with a dismissive hand-wave. "No *way* that's the reason!"

links.title: You: ""Strange, I don't have a clue.""
links.text: "Strange, I don't have a clue."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I can tell you it isn't something..."
links.text: "I can tell you it isn't something easy and immediately obvious, that's for sure. No way, that would be too easy..."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what kind of technological a..."
links.text: "Wait, what kind of technological advantages are we talking about?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Come on, officer, everybody knows..."
links.text: "Come on, officer, everybody knows about it." He rubs the back of his head, looking down. "The stuff they've got, most people here can't even *dream* of it..."

links.title: Drama: "He's just discovered that he can't..."
links.text: He's just discovered that he can't think of any examples, though.

links.title: You: ""Give me some examples, Gary.""
links.text: "Give me some examples, Gary."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Oh, you know like... uhm..." He ex..."
links.text: "Oh, you know like... uhm..." He exhales loudly and continues to massage his neck. "Stealth aerostatics, blaasma-powered weaponry, all kinds of deep-secret projects..."

links.title: Logic: "There's no such thing as blaasma-po..."
links.text: There's no such thing as blaasma-powered weaponry, because there's no such thing as 'blaasma.'

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""But that's nothing. Just wait till..."
links.text: "But that's nothing. Just wait till you learn *how* they've managed to get so far ahead of us..."

links.title: You: ""You're right, I can't even begin t..."
links.text: "You're right, I can't even begin to imagine what you're talking about."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Believe me, it's there. Technology..."
links.text: "Believe me, it's there. Technology so advanced it defies description..." He's avoiding your gaze.

links.title: Composure: "Because he's only now discovering h..."
links.text: Because he's only now discovering he has no idea what he's talking about.

links.title: You: ""That's crazy, man.""
links.text: "That's crazy, man."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""You think that's crazy, just wait..."
links.text: "You think that's crazy, just wait till you learn *how* they've managed to get so far ahead of us..."

links.title: You: ""How, then?""
links.text: "How, then?"

links.title: You: ""What's their secret, then?""
links.text: "What's their secret, then?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Isn't it obvious? *Someone's* been..."
links.text: "Isn't it obvious? *Someone's* been feeding them a little trickle of tech down from someplace *no-one* else can reach..."

links.title: You: ""That secret inaccessible bunker ne..."
links.text: "That secret inaccessible bunker near Land's End!?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""That old thing...? No, *the future..."
links.text: "That old thing...? No, *the future*. The Seolites are helping themselves from the future. And every little incremental improvement they receive in the present has *major* ripples all along the timeline..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""That creates a loop, right? The mo..."
links.text: "That creates a loop, right? The more advanced tech they send here, the more advanced they become in the future, which means that by smuggling ever more advanced tech down to the past... I'm sure you can see where this is heading."

links.title: Logic: "Within this self-contained logic-bu..."
links.text: Within this self-contained logic-bubble, -- a loop -- he is not wrong.

links.title: You: ""Wait, so how did they start the lo..."
links.text: "Wait, so how did they start the loop in the first place?"

links.title: You: ""You lost me there with the loop."
links.text: "You lost me there with the loop.

links.title: You: ""From the blue door in the Whirling..."
links.text: "From the blue door in the Whirling!?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""The blue...? No, *the future*. The..."
links.text: "The blue...? No, *the future*. The Seolites are helping themselves from the future. And every little incremental improvement they receive in the present has *major* ripples all along the timeline..."

links.title: You: ""From the pale?""
links.text: "From the pale?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""No, why would they be... No, I'm t..."
links.text: "No, why would they be... No, I'm talking about *the future*! The Seolites are helping themselves from the future. And every little incremental improvement they receive in the present has *major* ripples all along the timeline..."

links.title: You: ""From the future?""
links.text: "From the future?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""*Exactly*, officer." He leans in c..."
links.text: "*Exactly*, officer." He leans in closer. "The Seolites are helping themselves from the future. And every little incremental improvement they receive in the present has *major* ripples all along the timeline..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Oh, definitely!" He nod and repeat..."
links.text: "Oh, definitely!" He nod and repeats. "Definitely. How else did they get so far ahead of everyone in the tech-race?"

links.title: You: ""What's this 'digital castigation'?""
links.text: "What's this 'digital castigation'?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Well," he glances at the lieutenan..."
links.text: "Well," he glances at the lieutenant. "Essentially it's a grief ritual practiced by certain ancient Semenese tribes. Traditionally, after the death of a village leader, the bereaved are supposed to cut off a segment of their own fingers..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""What makes it really disturbing is..."
links.text: "What makes it really disturbing is the fact that they bite off bits of their *children's* fingers too. Even babies." He frowns. "Imagine that."

links.title: Half Light: "Yes, *imagine* it!"
links.text: Yes, *imagine* it!

links.title: Conceptualization: "Small hut, pregnant with screams of..."
links.text: Small hut, pregnant with screams of anguish and terror. The lowered head of the mother as she gnaws at the child's joint. Chewing, screams, agony. Finally there's a tiny crunch, followed by the sound of weeping.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Agonizing pain..."
links.text: Agonizing pain...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Please note: Tales of digital mutil..."
links.text: Please note: Tales of digital mutilation are a common trope of racist pseudo-histories, completely unsubstantiated by the archaeological record...

links.title: You: ""Gary, you're putting images in my..."
links.text: "Gary, you're putting images in my head and I don't like it."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Hey, don't blame me, officer." He..."
links.text: "Hey, don't blame me, officer." He puts his hands up. "These are barbaric people and barbaric times we're talking about. Dark magic."

links.title: Conceptualization: "In truth, these sound more like sce..."
links.text: In truth, these sound more like scenes from some old fantastique novel, the product of the author's fevered imagination rather than reality.

links.title: You: ""I don't know, this sounds made up..."
links.text: "I don't know, this sounds made up to me."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Hey, you asked me, officer." He pu..."
links.text: "Hey, you asked me, officer." He puts his hands up. "These are barbaric people and barbaric times we're talking about. Dark magic."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Tropes of fantastique literature co..."
links.text: Tropes of fantastique literature combined with mundane racial prejudice -- this is what the term 'pseudo-history' was invented to describe.

links.title: You: ""What does any of this have to do w..."
links.text: "What does any of this have to do with turning back time, Gary?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I'm getting there. See, the practi..."
links.text: "I'm getting there. See, the practice is derived from Semenese finger counting. Each segment of the finger represents one hour, so they count up to 12 with one hand, disregarding the thumb, of course."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Absolute nonsense across the board."
links.text: Absolute nonsense across the board.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""By removing one segment from their..."
links.text: "By removing one segment from their fingers, they remove the corresponding hour from their life -- that's what they believe, anyway."

links.title: You: ""So you're saying if I cut off both..."
links.text: "So you're saying if I cut off both my hands I can go back to yesterday?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""No-no..." He laughs nervously. "Th..."
links.text: "No-no..." He laughs nervously. "There's a discrepancy between how these Semenese tribes count and how they tell time."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""As I explained, they count up to 1..."
links.text: "As I explained, they count up to 12 on their fingers, but they divide the day into 15 parts. But that's a whole other discussion..."

links.title: Logic: "One you absolutely don't have time..."
links.text: One you absolutely don't have time for. Let's be done with this idiocy.

links.title: You: ""This wouldn't help me even if it w..."
links.text: "This wouldn't help me even if it was *remotely* believable."

links.title: You: ""Gary, you owe me at least a finger..."
links.text: "Gary, you owe me at least a finger or two for all my time you've wasted."

links.title: You: ""I guess I have to keep looking...""
links.text: "I guess I have to keep looking..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""No-no..." He laughs nervously. "Th..."
links.text: "No-no..." He laughs nervously. "There's a discrepancy between how the kipts count and how they tell time."

links.title: You: ""None of this is helpful, Gary.""
links.text: "None of this is helpful, Gary."

links.title: You: ""You know what? That's enough for m..."
links.text: "You know what? That's enough for me."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well,..."
links.text: "Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well, this is embarrassing, but I'm really not sure what else to tell you..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well,..."
links.text: "Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well, I suppose there's still the deep-secret Seolite technology to consider."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well,..."
links.text: "Oh..." He looks surprised. "Well, there's still the Semper Maa to consider."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Listen, there's no problem, office..."
links.text: "Listen, there's no problem, officer. There's still the Semper Maa to consider, as well as this advanced Seolite technology."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Essentially it's a grief ritual pr..."
links.text: "Essentially it's a grief ritual practiced by some old kipt tribes. Traditionally, after the death of a village leader, the bereaved are supposed to cut off a segment of their own fingers..."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""The really sick bit is that they b..."
links.text: "The really sick bit is that they bite off bits of their *children's* fingers too. Even babies." He frowns. "Imagine that."

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure these are realistic o..."
links.text: "I'm not sure these are realistic options." (Conclude.)

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I don't know what to tell you, off..."
links.text: "I don't know what to tell you, officer. I got all my information straight from 'Truth Hunt'. If you can't believe a radio programme called 'Truth Hunt', who *can* you believe?"

links.title: Logic: "Anyone whose livelihood isn't predi..."
links.text: Anyone whose livelihood isn't predicated on creating and maintaining preposterous mysteries?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "'Truth Hunt' is a popular radio pro..."
links.text: 'Truth Hunt' is a popular radio programme. Each week, its two eccentric hosts explore a variety of topics, from cryptids and conspiracy theories to ethnic warfare and the 'historical' Man from Hjelmdall. A radio counterpart to the Graadian fringe science magazine 'Paradox B'.

links.title: Endurance: "This guy has proved to be a dead en..."
links.text: This guy has proved to be a dead end. (A dissatisfied growl in you abdomen.) But the hard endure and the true kingsman keeps searching. 'Vaillance,' brööder, the night is darkest before the dawn.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Now *that* is a paradox," he smile..."
links.text: "Now *that* is a paradox," he smiles an all-knowing smile, like he just explained everything.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "A statement, seemingly contradictor..."
links.text: A statement, seemingly contradictory or opposed to common sense, and yet perhaps true. Or perhaps not.

links.title: You: ""Then we have already lost." (Look..."
links.text: "Then we have already lost." (Look down at your clenched fist.)

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I don't know officer... I think Fu..."
links.text: "I don't know officer... I think Future-Revachol might also have a few aces up its own sleeve. The people are starting to wake up, you see."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, people *are* noticing, Gary. T..."
links.text: "Oh, people *are* noticing, Gary. They've probably *dispatched* a team already." The pen in the lieutenant's hand glides on the rough paper of his notebook.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not to the present, of course, to..."
links.text: "Not to the present, of course, to past-Gary. They prefer to deal with problems before they become *unmanageable*. Just something to think about."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Hahaha..." His laughter is quick a..."
links.text: "Hahaha..." His laughter is quick and nervous. "I mean I'm basically just repeating what I heard on 'Truth Hunt' or read in 'Paradox B.' I'm just a messenger, and not even that, really!"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""And I suppose none of this would h..."
links.text: "And I suppose none of this would help *you* manipulate time personally, in any case. So why don't we just forget this whole business?"

links.title: Half Light: "Mmmm... the most beautiful smell in..."
links.text: Mmmm... the most beautiful smell in the world, fear.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You notice the lieutenant flinch an..."
links.text: You notice the lieutenant flinch and rub his forehead as if hit by a sudden migraine.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "God I hope he meant it sarcasticall..."
links.text: God I hope he meant it sarcastically. If not, I don't really see how he can continue being a police detective.

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Unfortunately, I suppose this *sti..."
links.text: "Unfortunately, I suppose this *still* doesn't help *you* manipulate time personally." He shrugs. "Sorry about that."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Though I suppose this still doesn'..."
links.text: "Though I suppose this still doesn't help *you* manipulate time personally. Perhaps you should consider digital castigation?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Though I suppose this still doesn'..."
links.text: "Though I suppose this still doesn't help *you* manipulate time personally. Perhaps you should consider the Semper Maa?"

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""That said, if you're interested in..."
links.text: "That said, if you're interested in manipulating time *personally*, I suggest you consider the Semper Maa or digial castigation."

links.title: You: ""Yes, that's the only explanation t..."
links.text: "Yes, that's the only explanation that makes sense."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""I'm telling you," he nods confiden..."
links.text: "I'm telling you," he nods confidently. "The truth can't be contained, people are starting to wake up and take notice."

links.title: You: ""Gary, that's insane. You are an in..."
links.text: "Gary, that's insane. You are an insane man, sick in the head."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""Hey man..." he spreads his arms wi..."
links.text: "Hey man..." he spreads his arms wide. "No one likes to hear it, but I'm not here to give you a false sense of security. It is what it is. People are starting to wake up and take notice."

links.title: You: ""You lost me there with the paradox.""
links.text: "You lost me there with the paradox."

links.title: Gary, the Cryptofascist: ""But then, there are rumours going..."
links.text: "But then, there are rumours going around that the Seolites have developed a technology that allows them to move through time like it's a corridor. Back and forth, you see."

links.title: Logic: "No. They haven't."
links.text: No. They haven't.

links.title: You: ""Yes, Gary. A trick. Now humour me.""
links.text: "Yes, Gary. A trick. Now humour me."

links.title: You: ""I don't joke around about time, Ga..."
links.text: "I don't joke around about time, Gary." (Stare at him intently.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant crosses his arms and..."
links.text: The lieutenant crosses his arms and turns to look at you.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You'd better be going somewhere cas..."
links.text: You'd better be going somewhere case-related with this.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He gave you a question for an answe..."
links.text: He gave you a question for an answer. Must mean the answer's obvious.
